creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile of male figure with large nose, wide, open smile, looking to L; sketchy hat and neck
inscription:
Stamp

-- inscribed on recto at bottom middle: indeciperable mark
-- in graphite on recto, lower margin: [6]
-- in graphite on verso, bottom of sheet: DTILKSL [TER added note: 82562]
markings: stamp on verso, LL: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg, Lugt 2811
provenance: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg (1863-1941), Lugt 2811, Donaueschingen (until 1982; sale, Sotheby's, London, no. 415, June 1982. [David Tunick, New York; sold June 1982, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Head of a Laughing Peasant
